newsitem.title: USA: SPS sees no impact from Tandy actions.
newsitem.headline: SPS sees no impact from Tandy actions.

text.p: SPS Transaction Services Inc said Monday it does not expect to suffer any material effect from Tandy Corp's plans to sell its Incredible Universe chain and close or sell some Computer City stores.

"Given our contractual arrangements with Tandy, we do not expect that their announced actions will have a material impact on SPS's financial condition or on the results of our operations," Robert Wieseneck, SPS president, said in a statement. "SPS will continue to own and serve the related portfolios."
SPS provides a variety of services, including network transaction processing, consumer private label credit card programs, commercial accounts receivable processing and teleservices.
Tandy said today it would sell its 17-store Incredible Universe chain and close 19 Computer City stores and relocate two others.
Tandy said the phase-out of the Incredible Universe chain will take about six months. It has 108 Computer City store in North America.
